alert.note: Alert for Dubois; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:27PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Dubois and northwestern Perry Counties through 400 PM EDT/300 PM CDT/... At 327 PM EDT/227 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Santa Claus, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Perry and southeastern Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Adyeville, Sassafras, Bristow, Siberia, Uniontown, Kitterman Corners and Kyana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
